results.title: The Hand of Stalin
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Tom Roberts, British Broadcasting Corporation and October Films
results.brief_description: A three part series examining the history of Stalinism in the former Soviet UnioN focusing on oral histories of people who lived through the turbulent and totalitarian Communist regime of the late 1930s. As they relive memories of collectivisation, the purges and the Gulags, the series becomes an almost unbearable testament to the brutality of power. However, by talking to peasants, intellectuals, former KGB and dissenters, the series avoids histrionics and controversy and allows the dignity of people’s voices to tell their own stories.

results.title: Folk, Rhythm and Life
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Skermer Famliy have been running the Bilyana ‘Folk Rhythm & Life Festival’, in north-eastern Victoria, since 1996 and in the process raising funds for local and international charities. The festival has always been environmentally sustainable, with the original “drop dunnies” developed by Hamish Skermer now being used not only in Eldorado but also at festivals in Australia and overseas.

results.title: Metamorphosis: DW
results.brief_description: A colour 2D computer animation in response to the project theme of metamorphosis. The head of a rhinoceros appears and wings then sprout to fly him away. Animator uses both soundtrack and foley in this short animation.

results.title: The Hat
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, John Hubley, Institute for International Peace and Storyboard
results.brief_description: An amusing treatment of the serious matter of World Peace and International Disputes. Two sentries are patrolling the border between hostile countries; one drops his hat and it falls across the line. When he tries to retrieve it war becomes imminent. Uses an interesting liquid form of animation. Dialogue and music are improvised by Dizzy Gillespie and Dudley Moore.

results.title: Noir
results.brief_description: The collaborative cut-out animation humourously puts a spin on an iconographical film noir scene - the chase. In a dark and deserted building a man (also dark) with his violin and limp follows a lone woman through the floors. Tension builds and eventually the mysterious figure is jumped by the woman who grabs his violin. A fight ensues with the turn throwing of a range of instruments at each other; a violin, tuba, piano all with accompanying foley. No credits provided.

results.title: The Harvest
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrayal of the kind of problems a rural clergyman is called upon to solve and how they add meaning to his work. In this film, Rev. Edward Dawson is asked by a farm couple to advise their son George against leaving the land in favor of a factory job in the city. Mr. Dawson finds a parallel between George’s problem and his own, for he too must choose between a city church and his rural calling. He is given cause to re-examine the stewardship with which he is entrusted and in it finds an answer both for himself and for George.

results.title: The Harp in the South
results.brief_description: Television dramatisation of Ruth Park’s novel following the life and times of a poor Irish Australian family in the aftermath of World War II. This is the poignant saga of the poverty-stricken Darcys of number 12 1/2 Plymouth Street in Surrey Hills - a Sydney slum with its complement of gangs, brothels and sly grog shops.

results.title: Shedding the dead things...
results.brief_description: A 2D hand-drawn animation, Shedding the Dead Things… if taken literally is a short animation about the grieving process. A woman grieves over a lost loved ones grave in a cemetary and is haunted by the ominous gargoyles that beckon her to remain in grief. Instead, she throws autumn leaves into the air with a gesture of rejection. Metaphorically the animation is about moving on and past the memory of personal pain.

results.title: The Hand of death = Shaolin men
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Raymond Chow and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: John Woo wrote and directed this action film starring Jackie Chan, Samo Hung, Dorian Tan and James Tien. Following the breakup of their group after an invasion from the rival Manchus, 8 Shaolin renegades form their own resistance group. They train under their old leader, until he deems them ready enough to challenge the Manchus and save the Chung Dynasty. Poorly dubbed into English.
